instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shorted PP3V3
threads.message: Im driving myself loco here, the board is clean except for <CHIP>U8005</CHIP> witch had very little corrosion under it, that is now removed and short still there on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>, but also <SIGNAL>PP1V05SO_LL</SIGNAL> is shorted, also <SIGNAL>PP1V05S0_AGND</SIGNAL> is shorted, I have tried injecting voltage and the PS goes as high as 2amps but nothing gets hot, injecting 3v on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> makes the CPU get hot.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shorted PP3V3
threads.message: If <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> and PP1v05 are shorted, likely CPU issue both are connected to the CPU. <SIGNAL>PP1V05S0_AGND</SIGNAL> is GND btw, so that rail doesn't matter lol.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shorted PP3V3
threads.message: [USER="1153"]JohnB8812[/USER] Thanks, GND stands for ground what a tonto I am lol.  Is there anyway I can test something else to see if indeed it is the CPU?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shorted PP3V3
threads.message: Pull every component on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> besides the CPU. If still shorted then RIP

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shorted PP3V3
threads.message: If CPU gets hot injecting voltage on <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>, no other reason than dead CPU; PCH side I suppose...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shorted PP3V3
